emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Ninth Cavalry mounted troop, with two men in front, in park
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, July 11, 1942, pg. 14, reads: "Pittsburghers Hail Fighting Men from New York's 372nd Infantry and Fort Riley's Ninth Calvary - Pittsburgh was full of military spirit over the holidays when members of two famous colored units of the United States Army participated in colorful displays of military routine... Top center: The famed Ninth Calvary [Cavalry] unit, composed of 47 picked men and horses, stand at attention during a review... Harris [illegible] photos."
